results.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
results.description:
Upflowy was founded by a veteran team on the core belief that growth plays a vital role in our everyday life, at every level, personal and company. Upflowy is here to help growth leaders build and AB test their lead and signup flows without the engineering burden. Up to 60% of marketing resources are being wasted on non-optimized first interactions with users. We’re here to solve that.

Beyond that, we’re here to define a new category of best-in-class experiences throughout the whole online journey, leveraging fast iterations and advanced personalization.

This is the perfect opportunity to join an innovative business that challenges the status quo and sets the benchmark for others to follow. You'll be part of an open, team-oriented, and results-based culture where your input is encouraged and your success is rewarded.

You can see more details about our launch on Product Hunt here. We’re proud to say we were the No.1 product for that week.

And we recently announced our latest funding round via Tech Crunch here.

 

Diversity at Upflowy

At Upflowy we know that diverse teams are better performing teams. Statistics show that certain parts of the job seeking demographic won’t apply if they feel they aren’t a 100% match to the requirements, but we want to change that. So even if you think you don’t meet all of the skills listed, or tick all the boxes, please still apply as we’d love to hear from you.

 

Senior Frontend Engineer

Day to day, here’s some of the things you can contribute to:

  • Working with our Engineering and Product teams to define and deliver a world class web-based drag-and-drop product
  • Solve problems across UI and CX to ensure our customers have the best product possible
  • Building high quality reusable frontend components
  • Driving best practice for code quality
  • Contribute to discussions with your team on everything from ideation through to architecture, design, implementation and support
  • Continually learn and hone your craft, whilst contributing to the learning of other Engineers

Requirements

Must haves:

  • TypeScript
  • React Web Component
  • HTML5 and CSS3
  • Micro-frontend
  • Experienced in Unit test (BDD or not), Cypress
  • Agile

 

Nice-to-haves:

  • Firebase
  • Tailwind CSS

Benefits

  • Attractive salary & ESOP
  • Salary Sacrifice for Equipment
  • Remote first working culture
  • Choice of equipment and hardware when starting
  • Team social events
  • Career path development program
  • 1-2 Team Offsites per year (pending Covid)
  • Tailored Health & Wellness Allowance
  • Education Allowance

results.title: Developer Relations Marketing Manager (Developer Advocate)
results.description:
Location: Vancouver or remote within Canada

We are looking for a talented and experienced Developer Relations Marketing Manager to join our team and will champion and promote our solutions to the developer community. Reporting to the Director, Product Marketing, you have a proven track record in leading conversations with technical users and developer audiences via a wide range of platforms and mediums, and have an uncanny ability in generating valuable content that speaks to their hearts.

You are also an effective communicator who can create effective positioning and content, and collaborate well with cross-functional teams to drive go-to-market strategy and to power product launches, as you will play a key role in shaping PDFTron’s messaging and positioning, influence the product roadmap and bring market and customer insights to R&D.

You have a creative mindset that thrives in a flexible and fast-paced environment, and you are eager to venture into the unknown and knock down roadblocks on your quest to deliver results.

Responsibilities

  • Build and manage marketing initiatives that differentiate us in the marketplace by creating unique and meaningful campaigns that not only help to drive engagement and reach but also build an emotional connection to our developer audience leading to a strong digital experience
  • Lead the conversation and actively evangelize developer communities about PDFTron’s technology advancements to aggressively expand our customer base
  • Identify, build, foster and engage an external ‘community ecosystem’ of our target developers & influencers in their existing communities to amplify our messages. Grow and manage our presence in developer conferences and meetups.
  • Deliver compelling content (e.g., YouTube, speaking at events, publishing/blogging, and through social media) to increase awareness, educate and inspire developers and build PDFTron’s reputation as a leader in this space.
  • Collect and disseminate common use cases, problems and limitations of existing solutions
  • Contribute to product marketing efforts including positioning, messaging and collateral, and to top of funnel demand generation activities. Articulate what our product is and the value it provides to users
  • Leverage data conventionally and laterally to design, inform, evaluate, and optimize what you do
  • Continuously develop your knowledge to keep at the forefront of the document processing, SDK, web apps, API technology industries' landscape, players, and competitors
  • Become a product expert with in-depth understanding of technical aspects of the platform and industry use cases.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Marketing or equivalent in a related field.
  • Strong understanding of how developers build software today (e.g. API, SDK, web apps, etc.)
  • Familiarity with marketing channels such as Discord, Reddit, GitHub, Telegram, Slack and Twitter
  • Experience with a developer-focused product
  • You have experience in all or any of these areas: growth hacking, marketing, sales, partnership development
  • Creative, critical and out-of-the-box thinker with outstanding analytical skills
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Self-driven and able to work independently
  • Naturally data-driven, familiar with analytics and reporting tools
  • Excellent organizational skills and above-average attention to detail
  • Passion for collaboration and continuous learning
  • Ability to work in a fast-growing start-up and tolerance for ambiguity

Benefits

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications.
  • A comprehensive extended benefits package including health, dental and vision for you and your family.
  • A great team environment and resources, supporting you to do the best work of your life and providing unlimited career growth potential.
  • Highly autonomous environment.
  • Virtual bi-weekly lunches and monthly socials.
  • Annual recurring WFH allowance for you to purchase items you need for your home office.
  • Excellent work-life balance.
  • Diverse and inclusive workplace where we all learn from each other.
  • Work remotely in Vancouver, Denver, or Boston, your choice!

 

At PDFTron, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents and digital content as the industry-leading document software development (SDK) technology provider. Companies that want exceptional document experiences for their customers embed our world-class technology into their web, mobile, server, and desktop applications. So you can find our SDK under the hood today used by software companies like DocuSign, Autodesk, IBM, Bentley Systems, and Microsoft; and by traditional companies such as Boeing, Wells Fargo, Thomson Reuters, FedEx, General Electric, and many more.

We are a fast-growing company in the $42 billion document processing market, expanding at a rapid, compound annual rate of 19%. Our growth is driven both organically and through acquisitions, with eleven companies acquired in the past 24 months alone, including iText – one of our top competitors. We were also chosen as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers of 2022 by Mediacorp Canada Inc and among Canada’s best employers for recent graduates with addition to its 2022 Career Directory.

As we continue to grow, the opportunities for career advancement and professional development are massive. We foster an atmosphere of growth and success, with each individual immersed in an exciting, challenging, and entrepreneurial environment with career progression based on merit, not tenure. Guided by a clear company vision, every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator, and successful leader.

Ready to join our team?

If you are interested in helping PDFTron deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now. Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
Thank you for your interest in PDFTron.

results.title: General Magic - Director of Technology & Services
results.description:
About General Magic

We’re an elite squad of designers, developers, system architects, researchers, writers and seasoned Web3 professionals. Our Mission is to make magic happen! We do this by providing solution services for Impact DAO’s. Our clients include ENS, Giveth, The Commons Stack, Token Engineering Academy, DappNode and many others.

Who are we looking for?

We need an experienced Director of Technology & Services to support our team by helping us manage our tech processes and workflows, provide guidance and mentorship to mid- level to junior devs on our team, and be a high level project manager to ensure General Magic continues to define the cutting edge of creating solution services for impact DAOs.

To succeed in this role you must:

  • Be a skilled lead dev and understand Open Source development.

  • Have past experience project managing software-focused products.

  • Manage projects on a high level (including speaking with clients, setting deadlines and planning project roadmaps), and also be willing to get your hands dirty!

  • Be an exceptional communicator of technical solutions and work tasks, both internally within the team and externally with clients.

  • Be a naturally empathic, supportive and organized tech team lead.

  • Be comfortable accepting, giving and applying constructive feedback.

  • Maintain a flexible work schedule, as our team navigates time zones all over the world.

  • Be fluent in written and verbal English.

  • Web3 and DAO experience preferred!

What you’ll be doing

  • You will be a leader within General Magic, and a core member to help us with our business strategy and growth plans.

  • Be a hybrid tech leader, product manager and project manager, who  loves to push the team forward and help us deliver amazing end results to our clients.

  • Be the tech lead for our team and mentor mid-level and junior devs, while  helping us build better processes across our organization.

  • Regularly review work flows and help us constantly improve our dev pipeline and best practice standards.

  • Be the point of contact for key clients;the bridge between the development and project implementation

  • Monitor project budget spending, keep stakeholders updated on progress, escalate any risks and propose solutions.

  • Develop project briefs, reports, and status updates - to share internally and externally.

  • Help us improve existing products, build new products and come up with bespoke products for client needs (writing product requirement documents and user stories).

  • Be comfortable dealing with clients; to satisfy customer requirements and pushing back when needed.

Qualifications

  • 6+ years working as a leader in the tech field.

  • Experience managing teams of 5+ mid-level to junior developers.

  • A hybrid product / project manager that still loves to code.

  • Has experience with the modern JavaScript tech stack (Node JS, React & Next JS)

  • Web3 and DAO experience highly preferred.

Pay and Perks

  • Competitive salary, with higher salary available for those with more experience.

  • Freedom of a flexible work schedule.

  • Work in the remote location of your choice; ideally between Europe, North America, and South America.

  • Crypto payment in a stablecoin.

  • Additional compensation package for future token launches - reap the rewards of what you help create!

  • Flexible vacation time.


 

The ecosystem of decentralized technology is quickly expanding in Blockchain, Web3, Open Source, and future unknown tools. If you value exponential professional growth and learning about new technologies initiatives everyday while contributing to the greater good working across different Impact DAO’s; this position is for you!

We look forward to meeting you and creating the new world of decentralized infrastructure together!

results.title: Full Stack Engineer
results.description:
Full Stack Engineer, North America, Remote

Who we are: 

We’re Polly, an engagement app that captures instant response on Slack, Microsoft Teams, and Zoom and helps teams make data-driven decisions instantly.  We are a remote, globally distributed team located in multiple time zones.  Polly’s best-in-class engagement solution continues to expand to organizations of all sizes.  We’re a lean, dynamic, proud and collaborative team leading the way as the go-to choice for engagement in the remote and hybrid work environment.  Polly is well-funded, cash flow positive and growing.

Joining our Engineering Team:

Every moment at an early-stage startup counts.  At Polly, we seek-out team members who are ambitious and curious, who operate with intention and passion.  As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll work to build the systems behind Polly’s one-time and recurring polls, surveys, and feedback workflows that run directly in Slack, MS Teams and Zoom. You will work closely with multiple stakeholders and make a big impact on our users.  We’re primarily working with Node on the backend and React on the front-end, in a modern development environment that features single click deployments on a daily basis.  We're seeking engineers who have an interest in working in a highly collaborative environment where you're encouraged to help mentor other members of the team.  This is an exciting opportunity to join an early team and gain exposure to everything it takes to rapidly scale a well-funded software startup.

You will:

  • Build, evolve, and support one of the most popular apps on the Slack, MS Teams and Zoom platforms
  • Ship high-quality software with a tight-knit engineering team
  • Get involved in every aspect of Polly’s products, from design to iteration and deployment
  • Develop, automate, and maintain our cloud and containerization infrastructure
  • Take part in DevOps rotations to support our production environment

What you bring:

  • Experience with multiple product life cycles of commercial software development in B2B, SaaS, and/or Cloud focus
  • Experience successfully building out solutions end-to-end and are comfortable operating in any layer of the architecture. Our tech stack is built on Node and React, but any past web development experience is suitable
  • User-centered, solution-oriented design experience and the ability to understand what the user wants and what you can deliver within the constraints
  • Strong communication skills and great problem-solving ability
  • Experience operating in a remote team environment
  • Technical and professional developer aptitude and ability to learn new concepts quickly
  • The ability to overlap working hours with the Pacific time-zone and enthusiasm to meet IRL, on occasion, for offsite and planning sessions in Seattle 

Compensation and Benefits:

As an early employee you’ll join the founding team on a journey to rapidly scale our enterprise SaaS business, with a real opportunity to influence our company, product, and users.  US based employees at Polly enjoy competitive compensation and great benefits including PTO, medical, dental, vision, equity, and more.

We encourage you to apply: 

Even if you do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to submit an application and cover letter with information about your background and why you want to work at Polly.

Polly is committed to a diverse workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

results.title: Senior Back End Developer (veritree)
results.description:
veritree is a planting management platform developed by tentree, a restorative apparel company that plants ten trees for every item sold. The technology that has powered tentree's tree planting is now accessible to other organizations who also want to help restore the planet through nature based solutions.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Back End Developer to join our Platform team. This role is oriented towards developing and maintaining the framework that powers our internal and external API.

  • For companies, we provide an API and web app that allows placing and managing of tree orders with us, as well as receiving reports on their planting efforts.
  • For planters, we provide a mobile and web app to organize planting projects and then facilitate the reporting, verifying, and tracking of trees.
  • For end customers, we provide a web application to allow customers to visualize their impact and learn about the trees they've helped plant.

As this is a remote role, all applicants MUST be eligible to work in Canada and have the ability to be available during our core hours of 9AM to 3PM PST.

 

What will you be doing?
  • You will work with the rest of the Platform team to maintain, improve, and expand the Laravel application that serves as our main API for our various applications
  • You will develop services, data structures, and solution architect as necessary
  • You will ensure that security protocols, best processes, and practices are being followed
  • You will write technical documentations while considering reusability, performance, and quality
  • You will be working collaboratively and cross-functionally in an Agile environment
  • You will mentor Intermediate and Junior Developers

Requirements

Professional Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in backend development using PHP (ideally Lavarel) and / or other modern languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python, Ruby, Javascript, etc)
  • Understanding of domain name & DNS management (e.g. CloudFlare)
  • Experience working in a cloud environment (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud)
  • Experience integrating with external providers (e.g. OKTA, NetSuite, SendGrid, mapbox studio)
  • Robust understanding of building scalable APIs for internal and external consumers
  • Proficient working with database schemas and data structures

Personal Strengths

  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills
  • Well organized and self-motivated
  • A good understanding of modern security concerns
  • Great at innovating solutions in a new space and a willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job done
  • Ability to pivot priorities and be flexible in design and development principles to match the fast pace of an emerging market

Benefits

  • Extended healthcare plan
  • Generous paid days off
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Opportunities for training and development
  • Employee discounts at tentree

veritree is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.

results.title: Backend Engineer, Protocol
results.description:

Archway is reshaping how value is created and shared across blockchain ecosystems. Initially incubated by Tendermint (Cosmos founders), Archway recently raised a $21 million seed round from Hashed and CoinFund.

  • Golang

  • Keep up to date with other defi projects and blockchain protocol to ensure we continuously improve

What you will need

  • Adaptable and ability to work in ever changing environment
  • Comfortable learning complex protocols from scratch

Nice to have skills

  • Blockchain experience
  • Rust 
  • Familiarity with the Cosmos Network ecosystem

results.title: Head of Engineering
results.description:
Head of Engineering

Deno makes programming fun. We make it possible to use JavaScript outside of the browser to build all types of software. The free and open source Deno runtime is one of the most popular projects on Github. Our earlier Node.js runtime is used by almost every website. As a business we are building the next generation of serverless technology, a JavaScript runtime for the cloud. Try it out — you ought to be able to deploy a server world-wide in less than 5 minutes that will be persisted forever and can handle arbitrary load.

About the Position 

In this position, the Head of Engineering will manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team, as well as the management and execution of software development projects against delivery commitments and project plans. The Head of Engineering will also be in charge of the management of the department's staffing, resources, and mentoring, and maintaining a best-in-class engineering team.  They will provide technical guidance and direction, as well as hands-on resources and project management, for all software development activities.  

The ideal candidate will have a profound understanding of new and relevant technologies, and will ensure the optimal application of engineering resources in order to meet product development and consumer requirements

Responsibilities

  • Oversee all software development teams and their respective projects.

results.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
results.description:
If you haven't heard of us

Staking Rewards is on a mission. Agency is the strategy, passive income from Crypto is one of our tactics in this strategy. We're building tools, platforms and products to help you, ourselves and others to achieve an impactful level of control over their income and help to improve the quality of their investment decisions.

We serve different kinds of stakeholders, investors, analysts and crypto community members worldwide. The narrative we're always pushing is Agency. We want you to be in control. ​​This is why we're on a mission to increase transparency, reduce entry barriers and enable everyone to become financially independent. We make staking easy & accessible.

Let's cut to the chase, Staking Rewards is a close-knit team, 20 some members all working remotely, all over the world. Working here means you pick your own timezone, you pick your own vacation days, have as many of them as you see fit, get compensated well, feel comfortable saying “No” and engage in intelligent dialogues with curious people. The only thing we ask in return is to bring your A-game. Get the job done, with a positive intent and a positive attitude. 

The person we're looking to work with

An Engineer that values quality over quantity. Has a deep understanding of software design and how to apply design principles on different types of problems. Some call them well-rounded Engineers or 10x Engineers, we simply call them good Engineers. 

Good Engineers can learn and adapt. They are creative and curious at all times. 

This is what we're looking for.

You will work with familiar technologies, but you will also be expected to work with unfamiliar technologies, you will learn on the job, you will challenge yourself and the status quo. Most importantly, you will be proud of your work. 

Nevertheless, we expect you have gained a good chuck of experience with different environments in your senior career so far and optimally worked in a React environment last so you can bring your A-game from day one.

Engineering at Staking Rewards

In two words, it's comfortable chaos. Our systems are constantly changing, evolving and adapting as the business alongside the crypto market does. Engineering in our environment means constantly facing challenges and being resourceful in our solutions. 

We work the problem. An Engineer at Staking Rewards is expected to inquire, communicate expectations and be open to unusual solutions. Our strength comes from our ability to deliver strong, high quality solutions in an ever changing business environment. 

We keep our feedback loops short and always aim to find the best possible solution together as one Engineering team.

Where do you fit in there?

You become one of the heroes in this saga. An Engineer capable of working on different challenges and storylines.

Some of these challenges we'd like you to focus on are

  • Building high performing web experiences
  • Bringing a strong defensive security mindset to our code and technical practices
  • Building for others: other developers on the team, for stakeholders and our users
  • Own the full vertical: shape, build, ship, monitor

Sounds good, what now?
  1. You send us your application
  2. Screening Interview with one of our team members (30 min)
  3. Take home coding challenge (max. 5 days)
  4. Interview Day
    1. Challenge Recap & Top grading interview with the CTO / Head of Engineering (60-90 min)
    2. Focused peer interviews (3 x 30 min)
  5. You give us three contacts as a reference that we will reach out to
  6. You will receive our offer
  7. Congratulations, you're part of the Staking Rewards team!

results.title: Senior Back-end Engineer
results.description:
Odin is setting the new standard of excellence on construction sites around the world. Our innovative SaaS platform ensures compliance, improves safety, and delivers operational efficiency by leveraging the valuable data generated on the jobsite. With Odin’s cloud-based onboarding process, new workers can be verified, badged, and ready to work in under 30 minutes, allowing safety managers to focus on safety instead of paperwork and compliance.

Our platform also provides real-time manpower visibility, making it clear who’s on site, how long they’ve been there, and whether they’re in compliance. Odin has already tracked over 4,500,000 labor hours across our portfolio of jobsites, which includes Related’s Hudson Yards, the largest privately financed construction project in the world.

This Role

As a Senior Backend Engineer at Odin, you will help to expand the functionality of industry-leading web and mobile applications that our clients use on some of the largest construction projects in the country. You’ll work closely with a lean, experienced engineering team as well as product managers, designers and business stakeholders to put scalable, efficient front-end applications into our clients hands and optimize their impact.

Your work will include:

  • Building out objects and operations in our GraphQL API to enable our web and mobile applications to perform sophisticated business actions with an easy-to-use interface.
  • Implementing new workflows and features that add important functionality to our platform and using quantitative and qualitative feedback from telemetry and clients to improve it over time.
  • Participating in sprint ceremonies including daily stand-ups, planning, retrospectives, and architecture discussions.
  • Reviewing code and having your code reviewed. We value a culture of feedback and continuous improvement.
  • Maintaining and improving our CI/CD and testing frameworks to enable faster and more confident deployments.
  • Collaborating with fellow engineers, product managers and stakeholders on the best approaches to grow our impact as a company.

Requirements

  • You have experience building and maintaining APIs, including design patterns shared across a team.
  • You’re adept with or are interested in building expertise with the following stack:
    • Typescript / Node.js
    • GraphQL / Apollo
    • Containerized development in Docker & Kubernetes
    • Google Cloud Platform
  • You’re a strong collaborator who wants to both learn from and contribute to a growing engineering organization.
  • You understand the important decisions that balance moving quickly with stability and maintainability.

Benefits

  • Work on big problems with big impact. You’ll have the opportunity to build brand new solutions solving important problems for a multi-trillion-dollar market. As an early hire in a fast-growing company, you get to help shape both the product and the team.
  • Great compensation. Including competitive salary and meaningful equity in an early-stage company. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package with medical, vision, dental, FSA and life insurance, parental leave, unlimited PTO policy and 401k matching.
  • The best tools to be effective. Company provided MacBook and home office subsidy
  • A fully-remote culture. We have no physical headquarters and plan to stay that way. We’re investing in creating our virtual culture, and providing the option to travel occasionally and meet your colleagues at sponsored off-sites.


Commitment to Diversity

Odin is committed to hiring the best team possible to build a labor management platform that works for real estate developers and construction workers alike. We have a diverse set of problems to solve, and believe that we need a diverse set of perspectives to provide the best possible solutions to those problems. We look for talent from different backgrounds - including but not limited to - race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, disability, and veteran status.

results.title: COE Engineering Lead
results.description:
Be Part of Something Big

Foxbox Digital is an award-winning digital product agency based in Chicago. We partner with clients ranging from Fortune 50 companies to high-growth startups and everything in between to design, develop and deliver successful digital products. We share a love of technology and challenge limits: we love what we do and each foxboxer brings their creativity to build and launch successful digital products.

We believe that in order to make an impact, we must do it purposely.

The person who fills this role is expected to have a large impact on the success of Delivery and their respective COE. Leaders in this role are capable of identifying priorities across all projects and keeping their team focused on creating high-value, including identifying appropriate project staffing and headcount. As part of keeping the team focused, the COE Engineering Lead will partner closely with the product lead to manage project scope and ensure the technical deliverables are met. In addition to focusing on the team, the COE Engineering Lead will support Sales by developing a set of materials to help position and package offers to potential clients and provide achievable estimates to sell the engineering work.

The COE Engineering Lead will spend less time writing code, though they still engage in technical deliverables and acting as technical lead on your chargeable projects, without blocking or slowing down the progress of their team. More than writing code, you hold the responsibility for identifying and clearing bottlenecks and roadblocks to success for your team. As an independent manager, you are comfortable managing team members with common and different skills sets. You can communicate expectations clearly using flexible leadership styles set clear direction and motivation for your team members.

You’ll be a valued core member of our team and help build cutting-edge applications for our clients.

  • Manages a center of excellence, identifing growth opportunities within COE to evaluate and develop for all team members.
  • Responsible for technical health and performance on all projects, accurate time-keeping, and achievement of team and individual changeability targets.
  • Explains and communicates challenges to Delivery leadership and works to build consensus at departmental levels.
  • Partners with management to define goals and determines how to use or hire resources to meet goals.
  • Has developed depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline to guide and participate in client-related projects.
  • Utilizes fully developed business knowledge and collaboration outside of department to drive departmental problems to solution.
  • Is available, approachable and accessible and is known to be willing and able to help when the need arises including small bug fixes and building out small features.
  • Supports Sales by establishing materials for selling services of the respective COE

Requirements

  • Prior experience supervising people directly or indirectly on engineering teams is desirable.

  • Desire to continue to pursue technical discipline: Mobile / Web / Back-end / DevOPs / Architecture / QA
  • Prioritizes and takes action on the needs of both internal and external clients to designs and deliver products and services with the client experience top of mind.
  • Capable of working well with others both on the team and cross-functionally to achieve individual goals, team goals, department goals, and/or organizational goals, valuing diverse perspectives and working with others as a way to achieve the best output possible.
  • Uses critical thinking to evaluate problems, gather information, understand causes, and identify best possible solutions, investing time in planning, discovery, and reflection to drive better decisions and more efficient implementations.
  • Effectively and appropriately interacts with others to build relationships, influence others, and facilitate the sharing of ideas and information. Uses tact and diplomacy to navigate difficult situations.
  • Thrives and grows in a rapidly changing and complex environment, displaying flexibility, activates networks of colleagues, and adopts a continuous growth mindset to learn from mistakes and bounce back from adversity.

Benefits

Technologies we use:
  • Backend: Node.js / Python / NodeJS / Go / Ruby / Java / .Net / Elixir / React Native
  • Frontend: Javascript / React.js / Vue.js / React Native
  • Mobile: Android / iOS

Why Foxbox Digital:

  • You are part of a multicultural and collaborative team that is constantly growing.
  • Don’t be afraid to break things; we encourage risk-takers.

Diversity and Inclusion

Foxbox Digital is an LGBT company certified by the Illinois and National LGBT Chambers of Commerce. We are committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams to continue building the digital revolution.

Foxbox is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all and team members with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
